title: These stopovers rock
text:
Singapore airport has its own butterfly garden Singapore
The world’s favourite airport is almost a destination in its own right, and until March 31, Singapore Airlines passengers get a £20 voucher to spend on lounge access, dining or duty-free. At Terminal 1, you’ll find the pool (£7.50, with towel provided) and the rooftop cactus garden. At T2, you can check out the orchid gardens, as well as free films and Xbox games at the Entertainment Deck. T3 has the butterfly garden, another free cinema and the helter-skelter — one ride for every S$10 (£4.60) spent in the airport. If you must leave the site, and have six hours until your connecting flight, you can join the free Heritage Tour (departs seven times a day) or City Lights Tour (runs twice daily). Look for the registration desks in the transit area.
